channel.title: NoMansBlocks on Eddie Abbondanzio
channel.description: Recent content in NoMansBlocks on Eddie Abbondanzio

item.title: No Mans Blocks - 10/13/2018
item.description: Where I’ve Been, and Where I’m Heading I took somewhat of an unplanned hiatus from working on No Mans Blocks. Initially, I took a break because I wanted to pursue writing a server for a Reddit clone.

item.title: No Mans Blocks - 6/4/18
item.description: Creating Time (literally!) I have a knack for forgetting what I’ve managed to accomplish on the game during the week. To try to overcome this so I have updates I can post on it, I’ve started writing down each accomplishment on a sticky note.

item.title: No Mans Blocks - 4/20/18
item.description: Playing Around at the Bit Level This weeks adventure has been exploring object serialization. Initially I was using the serializable attribute to convert my objects into byte arrays but for some objects such as the voxel chunks this is far from ideal.

item.title: No Mans Blocks - 4/8/18
item.description: Building Up the Network Logic While this week may not have much to show for it has built a solid foundation for networking. I spent some time refactoring the pre-existing network logic to try to clean things up.

item.title: No Mans Blocks - 3/31/18
item.description: Stepping back into Networking These past few months I’ve been on a tangent that wasn’t exactly planned. Diving head first into networking code, and attempting to refactor the voxel engine to support it really burnt me out.
